Wagner Labor ArchiveElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South10th FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2630tamiment.wagner@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2018-07-26T19:57:21Description is in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Morris Rosenzweig Papers
Rosenzweig, Morris
Rosenzweig, Sheldon L.
WAG.273
1.25 Linear Feet in one manuscript box and one oversized box
1950's; 1980's Morris Rosenzweig was the comptroller of District 65/United Automobile Workers. This collection contains clippings, booklets, buttons, photographs, artifacts, ephemera and a typescript on the history of District 65 written by Morris Rosenzweig. 1
Conditions Governing Use
Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Morris Rosenzweig was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist, materials are in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Morris Rosenzweig Papers; WAG 273; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Sheldon Rosenzweig (son) in 2008 and 2015. The accession numbers associated with this gift are 2008.004 and 2015.013.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Scope and Content Note
This collection contains clippings, booklets, buttons, photographs, newspapers, artifacts (jacket, caps, luggage tag), ephemera and a typescript on the history of District 65 written by Morris Rosenzweig.
Historical/Biographical Note
Morris Rosenzweig was the comptroller of District 65/United Automobile Workers.
International Union, United Automobile, Aerospace, and Agricultural Implement Workers of America. District 65 Distributive Workers of America. District 65 United Automobile, Aircraft, and Vehicle Workers of America. District 65 Rosenzweig, Sheldon L.
